title: Four children die after being swept away by the tides in Quebec
description: One person remains missing and six others were rescued by emergency services.

title: Hong Kong, once home to Tiananmen vigil, now hosts pro-China carnival
description: Victoria Park epitomizes the broader erosions in Hong Kong: In four years it has gone from candlelight vigil to heavily policed desolation to flag-waving carnival.

title: Kaija Saariaho, innovative Finnish composer, dies at 70
description: Ms. Saariaho’s music was admired by professional musicians and was increasingly popular with the general public.

title: Three Israeli soldiers killed by Egyptian police officer near border
description: Israeli army officials said they were investigating the incidents in coordination with the Egyptian military.

title: Religious leaders, once mostly spared Haiti’s violence, are now targets
description: Kidnappings, looting and other attacks have shuttered Vodou temples, Churches and mosques, making it difficult for worshippers to practice their faiths.

title: Death toll in India train crash passes 260 as rescuers rush to site
description: At least 261 people died and about 900 were injured after a three-train crash Friday in Odisha, India, according to local officials.

title: A night in Ukraine’s sleepless capital, taking cover from Russian bombs
description: Kyiv has suffered 20 air attacks in the past month. Each time the air alarm echoes, families must instantly decide where to take cover, how quickly, and for how long.

title: Use of NATO arms for attack in Russia raises doubts about Kyiv’s controls
description: U.S. vehicles used by anti-Putin fighters in a raid into the Belgorod region of Russia highlights oversight challenges for how materiel can change hands.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Moscow’s invasion is a warning for security in Asia, Pentagon chief says
description: At a defense summit in Singapore, Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin said Russia's aggression shows that security or prosperity in Asia “can’t be taken for granted.”
